author: Ejenix
description:
A collection of beginner combos for Sanae.
Not necessarily the most optimized in terms
of damage, but should be simple to pick up.

Some of Sanae's combo enders involve a choice
between 5b/6c/d623. Though d623 is the most
damaging, it will incur a heavy cooldown on
Kanako, so 5b/6c is recommended instead.
name: Basic Combos

scenarios.description:
5aaaa hj9 j5a j6a j5b/j6c/d623c
Midscreen

You can choose between 5b/6c/d623 for a lot
of Sanae's combo enders depending on if you
want more damage or to conserve Kanako CD.

Unable to combo if too far from wall.
scenarios.name: 5aaaa starter

scenarios.description:
5aaaa 6a 5b/6c/d623c
Corner

Easy way to limit in the corner.
scenarios.name: Corner 5aaaa starter 1

scenarios.description:
5aaaa (walkback) 2a 6a 5b/6c/d623c
Corner

A more optimized version of the previous combo.
A small walkback is needed before 2a in order
to prevent ending up on the wrong side.
scenarios.name: Corner 5aaaa starter 2

scenarios.description:
5aaaa 4card (Night of the Supernova Storm)
Midscreen

Basic 4card confirm.
Also works with 5card (Moses' Miracle),
scenarios.name: 5aaaa 4card

scenarios.description:
2a 3a 4c D9 j2c
Works everywhere except deep in corner

Your basic BnB.
Swap j2c for j8a if low on spirit.
scenarios.name: 2a starter 1

scenarios.description:
2a 3a 5c hj9 j5a j6a
Midscreen

Used when Suwako is on cooldown.
Most of the time you will be using
the previous combo instead.
scenarios.name: 2a starter 2

scenarios.description:
2a/f5a 3a 5c hj9 j5a j2a j5b j44 j6a
Corner

A way to convert off 2a in the deep corner,
which is the one place where your trusty 4c
BnB no longer works. Happens a decent bit
since you will often be using 2a for corner
pressure/staggers. Use j66 j2a over j44 j6a
for better oki but lower dmg.
scenarios.name: Corner 2a starter 1

scenarios.description:
2a 3a 5c 5card (Moses' Miracle)
Not too close to corner

Basic 5card confirm using 2a.
4card and 5card have roughly similar damage
and confirms but 5card has an advantage over
4card of being confirmable midscreen from 2a.

Damage varies slightly based on moves' timing.
scenarios.name: 2a 5card confirm

scenarios.description:
66b(CH) hj9 j5a j6a j5b/j6c/d623c | Midscreen

Depending on the distance to the wall, walking
forward may be needed before jumping.

Note the similarity to the midscreen 5aaaa
combo. The hj9 j5a j6a j5b follow up is also
valid for other counterhits that causes
wallbounce, such as with 6c/d623.
scenarios.name: Counterhit/66b starter

scenarios.description:
j5a j6a/j8a j5b 66 j5a j8a/j6a
Corner/Near Corner

An example of a way to convert off j5a hitting
on an aerial opponent.

There are more optimized routes involving j2a, but
the general idea of airdash cancelling j5b
into a melee attack remains.
scenarios.name: j5a air to air

scenarios.description:
j2a j5c D9 j6a
Midscreen

Another aerial combo example.

This one works on both grounded opponents and
standing opponents, given j2a is hitting at
the right angle (i.e. not hitting backwards
or too high).
scenarios.name: j2a starter

scenarios.description:
66c hj8 j5a j6a j5b/j6c/d623c
Corner

A reliable way to combo off 66c.
scenarios.name: Corner 66c starter

scenarios.description:
66c 4card (Night of the Supernova Storm)
Anywhere

Basic 4card confirm.
Also works with 5card (Moses' Miracle),
scenarios.name: 66c 4card
